sanskrit_verse:
सर्वेषां शावमाशौचं मातापित्रोस्तु सूतकम् ।
(जननेऽप्येवमेव स्यान् मातापित्रोस्तु सूतकम् ।)
सूतकं मातुरेव स्यादुपस्पृश्य पिता शुचिः ॥ ५.६२॥
transliteration: sarveṣāṁ śavam āśaucaṁ mātāpitrostu sūtakam | (janane'pyevameva syān mātāpitrostu sūtakam |) sūtakaṁ mātureva syādupaspṛśya pitā śuciḥ || 5.62||
sph_interpretive_translation: All beings undergo impurity upon death; however, for parents, it is specifically the birth-event that constitutes the ritual impurity. Upon touching the newborn, the mother alone bears the period of ritual impurity while the father becomes pure through contact.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority: Ritual status derives from direct causal participation in creation.
Causation: Impurity arises from ontological transition, not moral failing.
Capacity-based responsibility: Responsibility aligns with biological and energetic proximity to the event.
Restoration logic: Purity is restored through prescribed sequential action and acknowledgment of origin.
Consciousness alignment: Spiritual cleanliness reflects recognition of generative source.
executable_legal_axioms: IF entity is biologically generative parent AND physically contacts newborn THEN assign ritual observance phase to gestational carrier ONLY.
IF entity is non-gestational parent AND makes physical contact with newborn THEN declare immediate spiritual purity via acknowledgment protocol.
IF death occurs THEN all present entities enter temporary state of ritual non-conduct UNTIL completion of separation rites.
IF entity performs purification act post-contact THEN reset spiritual conduct eligibility automatically.
supreme_court_application: In adjudication concerning familial rights or ceremonial duties, the court shall recognize the primacy of biological causality over social assumption. Only the mother, having undergone the transformative process of birth, enters a defined ritual phase. The father's role is acknowledged through purification-by-contact, establishing clear thresholds of spiritual engagement without moral implication.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes cause as biological involvement. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as sequential spiritual states triggered by physical interaction. There is no punitive element—impurity is a natural ontological shift requiring procedural alignment. Responsibility flows from capacity, not fault.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Mother observes prescribed ritual cycle until declared spiritually complete.
Assumption Protocol: Father acknowledges generative moment through touch, thereby affirming purity.
Capacity Restoration: Both parties resume full dharmic function upon conclusion of respective observances.
Integrity Reintegration: Family unit resumes collective ceremonies once both parents have fulfilled individual roles.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source of Law. Dharma is restored through recognition of causal order. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness stands as ultimate adjudicator.
